snippet: The United States and Libya in the past three months have discreetly destroyed what both sides say were the remnants of Col. Muammar al-Qaddafi’s arsenal of chemical arms.
abstract: United States and Libya have discreetly destroyed last remnants of Col Muammar el-Qaddafi’s arsenal of chemical arms; campaign, which used transportable oven technology to destroy hundreds of bombs and artillery rounds filled with deadly mustard agent, also inspired use of the technology in much bigger disposal plan in Syria; officials hail destruction of Libyan stockpile as bright spot during country's continuing turmoil and unrest.

byline.contributor: Suliman Ali Zway contributed reporting from Tripoli, Libya, and David D. Kirkpatrick from Cairo.

lead_paragraph: The United States and Libya in the past three months have discreetly destroyed what both sides say were the remnants of Col. Muammar al-Qaddafi’s arsenal of chemical arms.

headline.main: Libya’s Cache of Toxic Arms All Destroyed
headline.print_headline: Libya’s Cache of Toxic Arms Is Wiped Out
